description.narrative: I beredningen av insatsen International Institute of Social Studies - Task Team april 2019-mars 2022 identiferades ett behov av att anlita en RBM-konsult (avrop från ramavtal) för att stödja TT att utveckla verktyg och etablera rutiner för uppföljning, lärande och utvärdering. Sekretariatet förväntas delta i arbetet utifrån sin roll som sekretariat, men TT bör äga processen. Cochairs bör ta ledningen inledningsvis men det är upp till TT att hitta en fungerande process och rollfördelning, exempelvis skulle en referensgrupp kunna skapas för detta syfte. Stödet kommer att erbjudas med start under våren 2019 och kommer att ges kontinuerligt under aktivitetsperioden, då erfarenheten visar att stöd över en längre tidsperiod ger betydligt bättre resultat än en engångsinsats.

Primary purpose: Support and coach the Task Team on CSO Development Effectiveness and Enabling Environment (TT) and its secretariat to develop adequate tools and processes for monitoring, learning and adaptive management as well as reporting.
Secondary purpose: Contribute to improved dialogue and understanding between the TT, its secretariat and Sida with regards to results based management.

Primary purpose: Support and coach the Task Team on CSO Development Effectiveness and Enabling Environment (TT) and its secretariat to develop adequate tools and processes for monitoring, learning and adaptive management as well as reporting within the project Continued support to the Task Team on CSO Development Effectiveness and Enabling Environment and its Secretariat. Secondary purpose: Contribute to improved dialogue and understanding between the TT, its secretariat and Sida with regards to results based management.

17.17 - Encourage and promote effective public, public-private and civil society partnerships, building on the experience and resourcing strategies of partnerships

description.narrative: I beredningen av insatsen "International Institute of Social Studies - Task Team" för perioden april 2019 - mars 2022 identiferades ett behov av att anlita en RBM-konsult (avrop från Sidas ramavtal) för att stödja Task Team att utveckla verktyg och etablera rutiner för uppföljning, lärande och utvärdering. Sekretariatet förväntades delta i arbetet utifrån sin roll som sekretariat, men huvudsyftet var att Task Team skulle äga processen. Stödet startade under våren 2019 och skulle ges kontinuerligt under aktivitetsperioden men på grund av bristande engagemeang inom Task Team avslutades stödet redan i december 2020. I slutrapporten som inkom 2020-11-06 beskriver NIRAS ett flertal utmaningar med RBM-stödet, se nedan: "As an outside consultant, promoting ownership is a very difficult task. Doing so within a network that lacks cohesion within and among its constituencies; lacks the leadership and ownership of the co-chairs; and is physically spread across the globe is almost impossible. While some progress in introducing RBM was made, the secretariat head never regarded managing for results as a critical issue. The problem was rather, from their perspective, the lack of committed co-chair leadership and stakeholder participation. For the secretariat, the key to solving this issue was not a RBM consultant, but for Sida to place pressure on its partners. The secreteriat head hoped that NIRAS would convince Sida of this. It is NIRAS opinion that while Sida could have made some progress by being more “heavy-handed”, it would result in a strongly donor-driven process that ultimately would defeat the purposes of the TT. With no other donor sharing the burden of financing the TT, Sida would be particularly vulnerable to being seen as a “donor calling the shots”. NIRAS managed to build a productive and amicable relationship with the secretariat. There was genuine appreciation from the staff who expressed that they felt the support was useful. Meanwhile, the co-chairs and some parts of the TT were more likely to regard NIRAS as something that the donor required and therefore had to be tolerated. NIRAS believes that during 2019 it helped the dialogue between the secretariat, enabled both parties to gain insight and understanding. The services contributed to some staff members of the TT secretariat to understand the concept of results based management; how, what, and why to monitoring results; and what tools and techniques could be useful for this. The secretariat also gained better insight how Sida regards RBM and system for monitoring, evaluation, and learning. Results based management is still, however, regarded as something “technical” by the secretariat head and the co-chairs. The concept of RBM being a management approach and a mindset has yet to be embraced. The services raised the idea the network being an objective in itself and ways how to monitor such an objective. However, more work is needed in this area. For any further progress to be made, the TT would require stronger and committed leadership".
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
